cscd211Methods

Class CSCD211Lab1Methods

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscd211Methods.CSCD211Lab1Methods

  • public class CSCD211Lab1Methods
extends java.lang.Object
    The methods you will mostly need to write to complete Lab 1
    NOTE: All parameters will be final and all preconditions will be checked

      • determineDirectoryFileNames

        public static java.io.File[] determineDirectoryFileNames(java.lang.String directory)
        Using the File class and no other classes this method returns an array of file objects that represent the names of the files in the directory. Hidden files start with a period and will not be included in the array.
        Parameters:
        directory - The directory where the input files are stored.
        Returns:
        File [] Representing all the readable non-hidden files in the directory
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the String is null or empty (must use isEmpty)

      • determineTotalPlayers

        public static int determineTotalPlayers(java.io.File[] inFileNames)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        This method opens the readable non-hidden files and determines the total number of players in each file to create a grand total number of players
        Parameters:
        inFileNames - The array of Files in the directory as a File object
        Returns:
        int The grand total number of players from all the files
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - To quiet the Scanner object when opening the file
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the array is null or length is 0

      • fillArray

        public static void fillArray(java.io.File[] inFileNames,
                             Player[] nflPlayers)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        The fillArray method is passed a created empty array of Players. This method opens each file and builds a player from each file for every player that is in that file. A player has a full name, a team code, games played and a positon all passed to the constructor as Strings
        Parameters:
        inFileNames - The array of File names
        nflPlayers - The created empty array of players
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - To quiet the Scanner object when opening the file
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the Strings are null or empty

      • readTeamCode

        public static java.lang.String readTeamCode(java.util.Scanner kb)
        The readTeamCode prompts the user to enter a 3 digit code and ensures the code exists in the enumerated type This ensuring is done without try/catch
        Parameters:
        kb - The open Scanner object
        Returns:
        String representing the team code that you have verified exists
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null

      • printArray

        public static void printArray(Player[] nflPlayers,
                              java.io.PrintStream fout,
                              java.lang.String teamCode)
        The printArray method prints each player for a specific team to the PrintStream object one per line with an additional carriage return
        Parameters:
        nflPlayers - The filled array of players
        fout - The open print stream object
        teamCode - The 3 letter team code as a String
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the array is null or length is 0, print stream object is null or the string is null or empty

      • readPlayer

        public static Player readPlayer(java.util.Scanner kb)
        readPlayer prompts the user for first name, last name, and 3 letter team code. Builds and returns a player
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the open Scanner object
        Returns:
        Player object with first name, last name and team code
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null

      • removePlayer

        public static Player[] removePlayer(Player target,
                                    Player[] nflPlayers)
        The removePlayer method uses the linear search method to check to see if the player passed into the method is in the array. If not in the array then Player not found is printed to the screen and the original array is returned. If the player is in the array then that player is removed from the array and an array of 1 smaller is returned. This method removes the first occurrence of the player
        Parameters:
        target - The Player to check if they are in the array
        nflPlayers - The array to see if the player is in
        Returns:
        Player [] The original if the player was not in the array or an array of one smaller if the player was in the array
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if target is null, the array is null or length is 0
